Message: Hi, Iâ€™m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
My lander was rejected, What should I do? A new ad or edit the one here?

If your ad was rejected, you have a couple of options. You can either modify the existing ad or create a new one, depending on the specific issues that caused the rejection. If the issues can be fixed with minor adjustments, like resizing an image or correcting text errors, modifying the existing ad might be more efficient. However, if the rejection was due to fundamental issues, such as content that doesn't comply with policies, creating a new ad that adheres to our guidelines from the start could be a better approach. For more details on handling rejected ads, you can check out this article: [My ad got rejected. What's next?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18085960681101-My-ad-got-rejected-What-s-next).
im trying to create another pixel and when I hit save ti show invalid action or something like that

It sounds like you're encountering an issue when trying to save a new pixel. Could you let me know which platform or tool you're using to set up the pixel? For example, are you using Google Tag Manager (GTM) or another service? This will help me provide more specific guidance.
gtm

Thanks for letting me know you're using Google Tag Manager (GTM). The 'Invalid Operation' error might occur if there's already an event with the same landing page URL or event type saved under your account. Here are a few steps you can try:

1. Check if there's an existing event with the same landing page URL and event type. If so, you might need to use a different URL or event type.
2. Try creating the pixel under a different account if possible.
3. Use the Event Tracking Tool to test and verify while still using existing saved events.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [Invalid Operation Error during Pixel or Postback Creation](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/502c292eb9f24075b90ee5330d330a28-Invalid-Operation-Error-during-Pixel-or-Postback-Creation).
how to delete an event?

Currently, deleting an event is not allowed due to potential issues with performance and shared account data. If an event is no longer needed, you can add a prefix like 'DO NOT USE' to the event name to avoid confusion. For more details, you can check out this article: [Pixel Deletion](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/82cf450c8d66451aa8b615bf982f3ac3-Pixel-Deletion).
i had an ad rejected, can I just Edit with a new url with the new page and wait for approval?

If your ad was rejected, you can fix the issues by addressing the specific reason for rejection. For example, if the rejection was due to an incorrect URL, you can update it with the correct one and then resubmit your ad for approval. Make sure to carefully review the rejection reason provided by Ad Support in your email and make the necessary revisions before resubmitting. If you believe your ad complies with our policies or if there was a misunderstanding, you can also submit an appeal by emailing adsupport@newsbreak.com. For more details, please check out our article on what to do if your ad got rejected: [My ad got rejected. What's next?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18085960681101-My-ad-got-rejected-What-s-next).
i got an email saying my ad is approved, but here its still pending

It sounds like there might be a delay in the system updating your ad status. Sometimes, it takes a little while for the approval to reflect on the platform after you receive the email notification. I recommend refreshing your dashboard or waiting a few more hours to see if the status updates. If it remains pending, please reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com with your ad details for further assistance.
ok thank u
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
my performance is no good, how can i pause the campaign

To pause your campaign, you can go to your campaign dashboard and select the specific campaign you want to pause. There should be an option to 'Pause' or 'Stop' the campaign, usually found in the settings or actions menu for that campaign. If you're having trouble finding this option, please let me know, and I can guide you further!
just toggle offon works
Yes, toggling the campaign off should effectively pause it. When you're ready to resume, you can toggle it back on. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
does it take a while to stop showing it bc when i refresh the amount spent is still increasing

When you pause a campaign, it may take a short time for the system to fully process the change and stop serving your ads. If you notice that the amount spent is still increasing after pausing, it could be due to ads that were already in the queue or being processed at the time of pausing. I recommend waiting a little while and checking again. If the issue persists, please contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
my ad is approved, but the campaign shows a warning

Warnings in your campaign can occur for various reasons, such as issues with targeting, budget settings, or ad content. To resolve this, check the specific warning message provided in your campaign dashboard. It should give you more details on what needs to be addressed. If you're unsure how to fix it or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com with the details of the warning.
It says No active ad sets

The warning 'No active ad sets' means that your campaign doesn't have any ad sets currently running. To resolve this, you can either activate an existing ad set or create a new one. Here's how you can do it:

1. Go to your campaign dashboard.
2. Select the campaign with the warning.
3. Check if there are any paused ad sets and activate them.
4. If there are no existing ad sets, create a new one by clicking on 'Create Ad Set' and follow the prompts to set up targeting, budget, and schedule.

If you need more detailed guidance, feel free to ask!
the ad set shows as REady

If your ad set is showing as 'Ready,' it means it's prepared to run but might not be active yet. Double-check the following:

1. Ensure the ad set is toggled on or activated.
2. Verify that the campaign itself is active and not paused.
3. Check if there are any scheduling settings that might delay its start.

If everything seems correct and it's still not running, try refreshing your dashboard or wait a little while for the system to update. If you continue to experience issues, please contact adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
it has the start date set as 08/09
Ive just changed it for Now

Since your ad set has a start date set for 08/09, it won't begin running until that date. If you want it to start immediately, you'll need to adjust the start date to today's date or remove any scheduling restrictions. You can do this by editing the ad set settings in your campaign dashboard. Let me know if you need help with that!

Great! By changing the start date to 'Now,' your ad set should begin running shortly. It might take a little time for the system to update and start serving your ads. If you don't see any changes after a while, try refreshing your dashboard. Let me know if there's anything else you need help with!
